fromString:
Depends on PAINTROID-160 / PAINTROID-161

Save image at regular intervals, restore on process exit
toString:
Save image in internal format (including layers, undo information) at regular intervals, whenever the phone is idle in between user actions. 

When the user saves the image and then exits the app in the normal way (i.e., without any additional edits), Paintroid can delete this temporary image data.

Background: 
* This is a two-star feedback of a user on Google Play: "Айтуар Мұхарам Mar 15, 2020 at 12:50 PM Auto-translated from Russian - The application is good. BUT WHEN I DRAWED THE WHOLE 2 HOURS AT THE LAST MOMENT, THE APPLICATION JUST TURNED OFF AND THE FIGURE HAS NOT BEEN SAVED. And I tried so hard. It was a shame. He just laid. And I deleted it ." 
* There were other similar reviews also, e.g., "Spyro The Dragon Mar 8, 2020 at 12:50 AM Auto-translated from Spanish - It is a very good app in general, even without pocket code, but, constantly crashing me for no reason, it is very annoying since sometimes I lose progress in what I was doing or even lose what I was doing completely". 
* And here's another one: "Jacob Howie Jan 25, 2020 at 6:19 PM ... if you go off the app (not close it, just visit Google for instance) it will delete your current project." 

This is also a simple solution for similar such cases, e.g., for Huawei phones with an aggressive battery saving mode as its default.

If we keep two such temporary copies, and only delete the previous one once the current one has been safely saved on persistent memory, there's no danger that data is lost while overwriting of the saved copy. If the saved copy is corrupted after restart, just use the earlier one. Only a single image data needs to be remembered in this way most of the time (besides when a new one is stored, for a short time, i.e., until the new one is safely stored). Once the app is restarted without being called with an image already selected, Paintroid could first check whether such temporary image data is present and is recent (within the last 60 minutes, e.g., maybe after a phone call), and if so, restore it, so that the user can continue from that place. It is also possible to ask the user in a small dialog whether he/she wants to resume, e.g., if the time is more than a minute ago. For below one minute, it should resume without asking --- there's always the option to delete the canvas anyway. It is OK if only the very last actions are lost, which might be unavoidable, but at least most of the work will have been saved and remembered.
author: wslany

fromString:
Ask user where to import image from
Add option to import from catroweb media library
Via webview or via Catroweb API
toString:
Ask user where to import image from.

Add option to import from Catroweb media library.

Via webview, which allows us to reuse 100% of the code of Catroid that does exactly the same thing for Pocket Code to import media assets. Note: in Paintroid, always use the generic "app" flavor (not the Pocket Code or Luna and Cat ones etc). Also, use only the webview for objects and actors (i.e., not the ones for portrait or landscape background images).
author: wslany

toString: Insert image from Catrobat media gallery

toString:
Ask user where to import image from.

Add option to import from Catrobat media library.

Via webview, which allows us to reuse 100% of the code of Catroid that does exactly the same thing for Pocket Code to import media assets. Note: in Paintroid, always use the generic "app" flavor (not the Pocket Code or Luna and Cat ones etc). Also, use only the webview for objects and actors (i.e., not the ones for portrait or landscape background images). 

Use the "Catrobat" logo, and the name "Stickers" for the button that allows the selection of this source option.

fromString: The main reason a user clicks on the text and puts in the textfield and then says ok, is to actually set it there. So the expected behaviour would be as described above.
toString:
The main reason a user clicks on the text and puts in the text field and then says ok, is to actually set it there. So the expected behavior would be as described above.

 

In case the text after all was not intended (which is the secondary case), the user still can tap on Undo.

from: As i remember this is actually not a bug but intended. It was implemented to avoid moving the tool if the user places the tool carefully and when removing his finger from the screen moves the tool a little bit due to jittering.
author: tobiasstangl

toString: This issue is fixed by PAINTROID-101
author: wslany

from: [~TobiasStangl] you are right. Well, the current way it is solved the object also jumps if you move slowly, so that's certainly not the way it was meant to solve the jitter issue, and makes not much sense as it is currently implemented. Fortunately we have found a perfect way in Catroid to solve the same issue there, which can now be copied in the same way in Paintroid. We discussed and estimated the corresponding ticket at the last Paintroid planning game already, PAINTROID-101, but it was not scheduled so far. I'm now moving it into ready for development and mark this ticket as a duplicate and reject it.
author: wslany

fromString:
Editing an image from Pocket Code in Pocket Paint of dramatically increases the file size.

E.g., just turning the [linked image|https://photos.app.goo.gl/3Eyhp5aGnG9v5YcXA] by 90 degree with Paintroid increases the file size in Pocket Code from originally 1.7 MB to 6.1 MB, as can be seen in [this screenshot|https://photos.app.goo.gl/Y1WjBN1dj8qgKSV7A]. 

Instead, we shall make sure that the file size is kept in a similar range after such simple edits.
toString:
Editing an image from Pocket Code in Pocket Paint of dramatically increases the file size.

E.g., just turning the [linked image|https://photos.app.goo.gl/3Eyhp5aGnG9v5YcXA] by 90 degree with Paintroid increases the file size in Pocket Code from originally 1.7 MB to 6.1 MB, as can be seen in [this screenshot|https://photos.app.goo.gl/Y1WjBN1dj8qgKSV7A]. 

Instead, we shall make sure that the file size is kept in a similar range after such simple edits. 

Maybe look at https://github.com/zetbaitsu/Compressor
author: thomasschwengler

fromString:
Once a denies the permission twice, he can save this setting and will not be asked again.
After that Pocket Paint generates a misleading I/O error message, while nothing actually failed.

The user should be given a notice to change their app permissions.

toString:
At second usage of Pocket Paint, the user should be asked if he likes the app (Yes/No).

If yes: Ask the user if he would like to rate us ("Yes" => Open Play Store with Pocket Paint, "Not now" => Close Dialogue).

If no: Show Dialogue "We're sorry to hear that! If you want to share your experience with us please write to contact@catrobat.org" (OK Button)
author: matthiasmueller

author: wslany

fromString: As a user I want tools to stay at their last intuitive position when lifting the finger. "Jitter" movements due to lifting the finger should be ignored. See
toString:
As a user I want tools to stay at their last intuitive position when lifting the finger. "Jitter" movements due to lifting the finger should be ignored. 

See https://jira.catrob.at/projects/CATROID/issues/CATROID-311 and PR at https://github.com/Catrobat/Catroid/pull/3393 for how this was successfully done in Catroid.  

See https://youtu.be/zl2Pn-f_HQQ for a video showing the current behavior with the stamp tool, when the zoom factor is high. The faulty "jumping" is repeated three times towards the end of the video.

The same also happens with the shape, text, transform, and import-image tools, i.e., all tools that have a quadratic selection.

All these cases can easily be corrected in the same way as in Catroid, see links above.
author: wslany

fromString: While user opens the side bars the current tools should be not active.
toString:
Currently it could happen that when you are using for example the brush tool and you want to open the side bar, the brush functionality is still active and you are opening the side bar and painting at the same time. Usually that is not the desired behaviour. 

While user opens the side bars the current tools should not executed.
author: vesnakrnjic

fromString:
There is a bug in the behaviour of "New Image".
New image should only clear the current image, without discarding the previous URI.

* Rename "New Image" to "Discard Image"
* Don't discard the previously chosen URI

For reference, excerpt of my conversation with Wolfgang:
{noformat}
Wolfgang Slany [14:57]
Better name instead of New image?

Thomas Schwengler [14:57]
Clear image? Reset image? I'm not sure
Well, since you can also use it to get a new image from the camera it would still be misleading :sweat_smile:
Should this be the same in standalone mode? I.e. should new image always keep the currently saved position?


Wolfgang Slany [15:04]
Please discuss this with @vesna. Maybe  "Discard image" would fit. For the standalone version, if the button is renamed to "Discard image" it should overwrite the original image.
{noformat}

fromString:
* Create a second layer
* Long click on bottom layer, don't move your finger
* Press delete to delete the top layer
* Swipe over the remaining layer
* Pocket Paint tries to merge this layer with a non existing one -> crash
author: thomasschwengler
